name: The Lost Weekend
description:
“From 30 feet away she looked like a lot of class. From 10 feet away she looked like something made up to be seen from 30 feet away.”  Raymond Chandler.

Enter Room 404 of a rundown hotel and enjoy a drink, your neighbour's tv-habits, or stretch out on a double bed that, just as the rest of the hotel, has seen its better days.

This is a small scene/level that is heavily inspired by film noir (yet made of assets not directly related to film noir), and that has been expanded upon with some interactive elements.  

There's a few things to do and interact with, but there's not a story or mystery to solve, at least not yet, so don't expect a full game experience. Approximate game time is around 3-7 minutes, partly determined by your curiosity.

You can however expect an atmospheric yet rather gritty, low-key experience, with lots of audio and a few things to discover. Works best in the dark, with headphones.

Tips:

If the neighbour annoys you, you can do something about it.

If you are stuck in a chair or on the bed; press o (the letter) or x on x-box gamepad.

After the start menu there's support for both PC and X-box gamepad.

PS!

The Windows download is a 64-bit file.
